meanings.definition: Resembling sandpaper in texture or roughness.
meanings.sent1: The cat's tongue felt sandpapery as it licked my hand.
meanings.sent2: The old book had a sandpapery cover from years of use.
meanings.sent3: The sandpapery towel scratched my skin like a tiny kitten.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a sandpapery quality, rough and grating.
meanings.sent5: The sandpapery surface of the rock scraped my palm as I climbed.

meanings.definition: Having a rough or abrasive quality similar to sandpaper.
meanings.sent1: The chef's hands felt sandpapery from working with spices all day.
meanings.sent2: The sandpapery sound of the wind against the window kept me awake.
meanings.sent3: The sandpapery welcome mat scrubbed the dirt off our shoes.
meanings.sent4: Her humor was sharp and sandpapery, always catching you off guard.
meanings.sent5: The sandpapery feedback from the teacher made me strive to improve.
